knimeNode.name: Sharepoint Online Connector (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Connects to Sharepoint in order to read/write files in downstream nodes.

intro.p: This node connects to Sharepoint. The resulting output port allows downstream nodes to access the Sharepoint data of a site as a file system, e.g. to read or write files and folders, or to perform other file system operations (browse/list files, copy, move, ...).

Path syntax: Paths for Sharepoint are specified with a UNIX-like syntax, /mydrive/myfolder/myfile. An absolute for Sharepoint consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the name of a drive (a.k.a. document library) ("mydrive" in the above example), followed by a slash.
Followed by the path to the file ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).

fullDescription.option:
There are three ways to specify Sharepoint site:
Using a root site.
User can specify the web URL of the site
Team site: user can specify name of the group
The web URL of the site.
It is possible to connect to one of the subsites of a given site. Use the fetch button to list all available subsites.

Specifies the working directory using the path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. If not specified, the default working directory is "/".
Timeout in seconds to establish a connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.
Timeout in seconds to read data from an established connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.
